author: Hadlee Simons
title: Watch homemade railgun in action
text:
Are you covered? Compare quotes for car, life and business insurance right now! 
Sign up for your free fax number and get faxes sent to your inbox! Watch homemade railgun in action Article By: Hadlee Simons Tue, 20 Oct 2015 1:36 PM Share A homemade railgun. Credit: YouTube user xtamared 
Who says that railguns are only the domain of the military and videogames? 
Certainly not one mysterious man, who created a railgun out of 3D-printed parts and other easily accessible components. 
The inventor uploaded a series of photos to imgur and several videos to YouTube. 
The railgun is capable of firing aluminium, graphite, copper-plated tungsten, carbon and teflon/plasma. 
According to the user, the railgun is capable of firing rounds at up to 250 metres per second (equivalent to 900 kilometres per hour). 
In other words, it's nothing to scoff at, although the US military has tested railguns with speeds of over Mach 5 (6100 kilometres per hour). Read More
